subsection_content:
To diagnose the disease, your doctor will measure the shape of your cornea. There are many different ways, but the most common is called corneal topography. The doctor takes pictures of your cornea and examines it carefully. (2)
Measuring corneal topography is one of the methods to diagnose keratoconus
Some factors for the diagnostician to consider include: whether the patient has astigmatism, whether the cornea has an elongated shape like a rugby ball or a spherical shape like a basketball; Does the patient have nearsightedness; The patient has symptoms of nearsightedness and astigmatism; corneal mapping, corneal topography; Check the cornea with a biological microscope to check for wrinkles in the cornea...
If your family has parents with keratoconus, your child should be screened for this disease every year, starting at age 10.
